website_summaries.verdict: This product works on all metal. It is a strong formula that will make your metal look like new.
pros: Can be used on cars, instruments, family silver, or jewelry
Does a great job removing water marks from chrome faucets
Works better than many other metal cleaners on the market
cons: This product will shine, but is not designed to take out fine scratches

customer_reviews.title: I used this product this morning and they are like new! I've cleaned all the fixtures now and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after reading the reviews on Amazon. Our whole house has polished nickel fixtures and I had been noticing small watermarks over the last couple months that couldn't be wiped off. After we had cleaners come to the house, I noticed that whatever they used on the faucets seemed to have corroded the nickel. I tried everything to get them clean, but nothing worked. I used this product this morning and they are like new! I've cleaned all the fixtures now and couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is scary good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not super familiar with polishing metal, but I'm pretty sure there's some witchcraft going on here. This funky pink paste eats dirt & tarnish for breakfast. In no time at all, it got crusty old jewelry I was about to throw away to a mirror finish. Even with the cheap silver-plated stuff, it got the exposed copper so light and shiny that the wear is hardly noticeable. I got through my jewelry and then went around the house polishing all the metal fixtures I could find 😂 Going to tackle the coin collection next! And I've hardly put a dent in the tube. It's going to last me a long time. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Compare to Flitz
customer_reviews.text: So I've heard a lot of online talk about Simichrome and Flitz. I have always used Flitz myself but decided to try Simichrome. I took two 6061 aluminum plates and sanded them both evenly to 400 grit. Started with 120 to remove minor surface imperfections and 400 to smooth it out a bit. I then went over them briefly with 1000 grit. I did 1 application of both and the Flitz was the clear winner. I ended up having to do 3 applications of Simichrome to achieve the same result. I will say sanding makes a world of difference. I normally sand to 2000 grit first which after flitzing produces a great reflection.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Forget everything you think you know about metal polish...
customer_reviews.text: When you think you've been using the right polish for years, when all-of-a-sudden you stumble across this stuff and realize your entire life is a lie. Simichrome isn't cheap, but I can promise you that you'll toss your other stuff in the trash, or hand it off to a friend. There's no going back after you've rubbed this stuff on any and all metal finishes you can find. I used Simichrome with a medium buffing pad on my DA and was able to polish clear coat overspray off of the bumpers on my classic Buick. Polished 45 years and a bad painter away in seconds. Awesome stuff.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Simichrome is Excellent Polish for Brass Instruments
customer_reviews.text: I own a musical instrument repair shop and use this stuff ALL THE TIME. It is the best stuff out there for polishing difficult alloys like nickel silver (copper/nickel) that has become badly tarnished. Far better than Wenol or anything else I have ever used short of my expensive rotary buffing machines. For hand work on delicate stuff with a heavy patina, this is THE stuff to use.
customer_reviews.author: PachydermTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: One coat of this and it not only shines the chrome like new, but it provides a protective coating to ...
customer_reviews.text: My ex husband used to use this on his motorycle all the time back in the day. Now, 30 years later I have my own Harley with a lot of expensive chrome. I have tried other products but went back to Simichrome because it works so well. The other thing is that I live at the beach so pitting and other problems happen quickly on the chrome if you don't take care of it. One coat of this and it not only shines the chrome like new, but it provides a protective coating to protect the chrome from the elements. Don't bother with other products for the chrome on your motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Brigette Beisner

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is a Wonder Polish on Copper, Cres ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a Wonder Polish on Copper , Cres, Brass, Nickel, Nickel - Copper, Copper - Nickel , Titanium, 316L , any metal that's a precious metal or not really , cheap coated brass will polish too .. but Aluminum , last process , after 200 , 300 , 500 , 1000, 1500 , 2000 grits to rouge red to white, to Simichrome , aluminum to a Mirror Finish if you have the time and the ability to polish !
customer_reviews.author: Dv

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I bought Simichrome to restore some 20-year-old brass hardware on a house I’m renovating, with little hope it would actually work, but it did. Some of the tarnish simply wiped away, but for that old, caked on tarnish, I left the Simichrome on overnight. I found polishing with a dense sponge and a paper towel worked the best for removing the tarnish and making the chrome pieces shine. I’ve been super impressed and will definitely buy Simichrome again. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Toxic
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely toxic. You must use it an a well ventilated room, being careful not to breath fumes or have contact with skin. The warnings are frightening. The box states if the product is mishandled death may occur. I was simply looking for a great silver polish. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Hantz

customer_reviews.title: This is the best polish there is by far!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for decades. There is NOTHING better. Use it on Jewelry, anything that's tarnished. One thing... READ THE INSTRUCTIONS.... when they say you only need a tiny amount... it's exactly true. Bought this for my kids to clean their rings, chains etc. I've used it to polish chrome, copper, brass, even Stainless steel guns, etc. Just a small dab on a clean cloth and when it turns black almost immediately, don't panic, it's working. You don't need any more on the cloth. A friend hooked me on this decades ago and he equally raved about the stuff. A tube will last you years. If not, you're either a Professional cleaner or you're using too much!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Brings the luster back
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to this product yrs ago when a military friend used it to polish his metals....infact, everyone in the service used it. I was hooked! I primarily use it for my jewlry. however I found a new use....the keys to my post office box were looking 'dirty' over time....nasty actually but the convential things to clean it didn't work....I tried this and the keys are like a mirror~I would recommend wearing rubber gloves when you use it.....can blacken your fingers from the 'stuff' it takes it takes off. Just put a small amt on a clean cloth and run your ring thru it....then wipe w/ a clean cloth. Do it several times.
customer_reviews.author: Shortstop

customer_reviews.title: This stuff will make you a restoration god
customer_reviews.text: This polish is better than winning the lottery while riding a unicorn through a field of diamond-studded trees after drinking Liquid Luck potion. I'm not kidding. I used it on the keys of a 100+ year old flute, and I feel like a heathen for making the thing look like brand-spanking new. Seriously, this shouldn't be allowed, this shockingly magic potion. Such a tiny, tiny amount is pants-on-head crazy effective. Add a Dremel polishing pad and you'll be inducted into Olympus as a god.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Piper

customer_reviews.title: Good ‘ol Simichrome😁
customer_reviews.text: The watchmakers best friend; carefully and sparingly applied on small parts, it removes any and all corrosion with little effort. Also great for cleaning old automobile headlights; I’ve applied a small amount to a cotton rag and, rubbing lightly with a circular motion, removed years-worth of cloudy film. No disappointments here, just a product that works!
customer_reviews.author: timekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I had 90 years old brass plated pulls to clean. I started cleaning them with Semichrom polish but it required too much effort so I first covered them in aluminum foil and soaked them for an hour in hot water with salt and baking soda to soften the patina and then clean them with Semichrom changing paper towel several times. They were almost black and now are absolutely lustrous.
customer_reviews.author: ADC

customer_reviews.title: Great for tarnished nickel on Buck Knives!
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple custom Buck knifes that had just been sitting in their holsters/sheathes. Took them out the other day and discovered a decent amount of tarnished nickel. Searched around home depot and target to find something to use... didn't find anything i was comfortable to use. Searched around on line and read about "Simichrome." Decided I would spend $8-9 on a tube and take a chance. The stuff is legit. And a little bit of it goes a long way. One tube will probably last me for years. My Buck Knives look virtually brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Adelino L.

customer_reviews.title: Will cover soft metals with tiny surface scratches.
customer_reviews.text: Despite what the description says about polishing "heirloom silver without a scratch", I found that while this product did a great job shining up my silver very quickly, it also completely blanketed my silver piece in a layer of very fine scratches visible under light from certain angles. I've had to purchase a buffing wheel and spend several hours at this point reversing the damage with jeweler's rouge, and I am still not done. Jeffrey Herman's website on silver preservation lists this polish as being far too abrasive for use on silver, and I wish I had seen this earlier before I read this misleading description. Do not use this polish on soft or precious metals.
customer_reviews.author: Ream Sherm

customer_reviews.title: Great for sharpening razors
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to purchase the expensive replacement blades for my Norelco razor so after watching a YouTube video, I bought a tube of this. I got a small mirror, put a dab of polishing compound on it, and put the rotary blade on it and moving it around in a circular motion for a few minutes, sharpened each blade, then rinsed well with water and reassembled the razor. NO MORE hair pulling , just a clean, close shave again, saving me about $30-40.
customer_reviews.author: radcont51

customer_reviews.title: Works good on strinless cabinets.
customer_reviews.text: I had various stainless cabinets in the kitchen that had a couple stains running down them and tried the usual, stainless cleaner, baking soda (which was good at getting the rust off and other stains), CLR etc. All worked somewhat but you could still see the stain. This stuff worked like a champ and removed the stain. I used just a little on a paper towel, rubbed until it turned black, another clean paper towel, followed by 409 and wipe (to get the remaining black residue off) then the stainless cleaner to give it an even shine.
customer_reviews.author: Spilled Paint

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing - Results are Beautiful on Brass
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a 400-day anniversary clock and it worked better than anything else I have tried. It goes on easy and comes off easy. My only recommendation is to have a lot of rags or thick shop towels around as they get dirty quick. I used blue auto shop paper towels and they work great. I got the best results by changing the spot on the towel as soon as it got black – which is pretty quick. This prevented me from rubbing black back into the brass. Again, the results were simply amazing – excellent product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Old school polish.
customer_reviews.text: This product has been around for many years, hard to find it in stores. I have always used it on stainless steel and it provides a chrome like finish if you put in the effort. I wanted to polish some stainless steel parts in my engine (alternator and thermostat housing) they had started to tranish, this brought out a nice chrome like finish not quite as shiny as chrome but A LOT cheaper than replacing those parts with chrome parts (11 dollars for this vs 130 for a chrome alternator).
customer_reviews.author: kenpo saber

customer_reviews.title: Tarnished Nickel Now Shines
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, this product does work great on nickel plated parts. I have a Gretsch guitar with nickel plated volume and tone knobs, a jack plate and pickguard brace. All were terribly tarnished to the point I thought the plating was defective. When I realized these parts were nickel plated I decided to give the Simichrome a try. It is very easy to use and just a little bit of polish and a little bit of polishing is required to achieve a high gloss. Guitar looks like new again.
customer_reviews.author: D-String

customer_reviews.title: It really works to restore shine to polished nickel
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! I used it to bring back an original shine to my polished nickel gooseneck faucet in my newly remodeled kitchen. The polished nickel gets water spots and looked aged. A tiny dab the size of a small pearl or pea on a lint free rag and I gently buffed out the discoloration and spots. The product should last me a lifetime, or at least many years even though the tube is smaller than a tube of toothpaste. A great investment and I will buy again if the tube ever runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally used a yellow/green scrubber sponge to clean my bathroom faucets, and before I knew it, I had scratched the chrome finish. Just had some swirl marks in the chrome, so I thought this product would take them out. Unfortunately it did not. It was only sponge marks too, not very deep. But this product did not take them out. Seems to have shined up the chrome a bit, but the light scratch marks are still visible. Maybe I'll give it another go and polish for a good long while, but as it stands, the product did not work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Allan RTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: I owned a hobby shop between 1986 and 1990. During that time I was introduced to Simichrome Polish which was imported from Germany. Well, we closed shop in 1991 and we still had one tube left. I could not find it anywhere near us. Flash forward to 2018... I used up my last little bit of Simichrome polish after all these years, and decided to check Amazon! Yay! I found it. This polish is far superior to any other I have used. It take a pea sized bit or less for most things. I have used it on gold, silver, bronze, and copper. This cleans and brightens the metal like nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: renee

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Product
customer_reviews.text: Was introduced to this product by a friend who had been using it for years to clean and polish his gun barrels. He demonstrated it and could not believe how good the metal looked after without removing the bluing. I bought a tube and subsequently used it on chrome cladded aluminum truck wheels with phenomenal results. Like the description says, it does not leave and abrasive marks. This is a great product for polishing a variety of metals.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: SIMICHROME! BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: I caused a lot of light scratches polishing the 'Nickel Buckles' on my Custom Buck 110 Hunter with cotton-swabs and Bra**o, totally killed the looks, it went from having beautiful 'Nickel Buckles' to 'scratched-to-'he**'. Simichrome (with a microfiber cloth) didn't bring it all the way back to 'like new', but it was at least an 80% improvement, and really made my Buck 110 Hunter look great again!
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: This is the best chrome cleaner I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best chrome cleaner I have ever used. I have always kept my vehicles like new and have had many since I’m 63. I keep my motorcycles looking like new with this stuff. I have tried just about every chrome polish on the market and since I found this about 15 yrs ago. It’s all I’ll use. Use to buy it at my local Harley store, but they don’t carry it any more. Had to order it form here. You don’t need much and it goes a long way. I use it only on the chrome.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Cleans cheap metal costume jewelry!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never in my life had a product that shines metal like this. And its made in Germany which is awesome for quality. I had cheap tarnished chinese jewelry and now it looks like i got it from a high end jewelry store. No exaggerating, i just received it tonight, triez it already and am typing u this review while i am still in shock.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kennett

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine As Intended, Not For Bakelite Testing
customer_reviews.text: Well it works as a metal polish, though it's fairly expensive compared to alternatives. However I, like many I imagine, bought this to test for Bakelite on several recommendations. Used on known Bakelite, the color barely changed. Used on common plastics, the color also slightly yellowed. So this is useless for my purposes. I guess I'll use it if I ever run out of mothers mag/al polish.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: It works on polished nickel!
customer_reviews.text: My contractor hung a brand new polished nickel light fixture in my home, and I noticed large dull spots on the bottom one week later. Figuring that it was either defective or damaged during construction at my home, I called the lighting company for advice. They recommended a polish from Walmart that didn't work. I took a leap of faith and purchased this on Amazon. After approximately 6 applications and 30 minutes of scrubbing, the spots were gone. It's amazing! My $700 light fixture is like new!
customer_reviews.author: Sep

customer_reviews.title: Simichrome to the rescue !!!
customer_reviews.text: My little tube of Simichrome saved my day! I had a new refrigerator installed today, and after the guys left, I noted a few very fine scratches in the stainless steel handles. My first impulse was to call the appliance store, my second was to try to clean (or buff off) the scratches. One application made them less noticeable, two made them disappear completely. Love this polish ! I originally purchased it for the backside of my IPhone - it had a few scratches from being in a case. It cleaned and smoothed the metal surface to almost new appearance.
customer_reviews.author: TheXRAYest

customer_reviews.title: Little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: Smells like the old days, this product polished nickel and stainless steel beautifully for me. Be patient take your time and the results are stunning. My only complaint is that it leaves a “protective” finish in the surface that is prone to leaving behind finger prints and smudges but after it sets for a while it’s not as bad. Just use care handling the polished surface after use if you care about presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Simichrome Metal Polish
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean up a 50 year old sterling silver fountain pen. I needed to remove all of the grime and tarnish that had accumulated over the years but very, very gently. I’d tried a couple of different products and the results were less than optimal. Simichrome cleaned everything and the results were just what I’d hoped for! The pen was shinny and clean! All the grime of the years gone leaving me with a beautiful collectable fountain pen in terrific shape! I used it on another duplicate pen that had been in the same condition and Simichrome left this collectable in the same great condition! Great product and happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: aawillis

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome
customer_reviews.text: As a jeweler and watchmaker I can tell you this with no hesitation as a jeweler and watch maker I can tell you this with no hesitation this is one of the best polishes I have ever used and I've used them all buy it you will not
customer_reviews.author: TOM THUMB

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t remove small scratches
customer_reviews.text: Bought to buff out scratches on stainless steel sink. Nada. Thought ok, well at least I can really clean off the hard water marks and make this sink really shine. Nope. And the smell is horrific. Total letdown.
customer_reviews.author: RainRiverOcean

customer_reviews.title: good for polished nickel fixtures
customer_reviews.text: I have a few polished nickel faucets, which tend to get spots or tarnish very easily. This is the best product I've found so far to get them back to a nice shiny finish. Just smear a thin layer using a damp cloth, then wipe off with a dry soft cloth. Depending how bad it is, you may have to do it a couple times and apply a bit of pressure while wiping.
customer_reviews.author: AReader

customer_reviews.title: Great polish!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to sharpen my husband's electric shaver heads. Worked great. Then I tried it on our vehicle's chrome wheels. They had dull water spots or something I had tried several things to remove and clean them. Vinegar worked with repeated scrubbing. Put this polish on, wiped off, and they were gone. Easy peasy with a beautiful shine!
customer_reviews.author: DLC

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love and recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to see if I could bring my Louis Vuitton marceau gum bag back to life; And oh my God I love it. It cleaned and polished every single hardware including the zipper from my purse and dint even make a dent to the bottle. I swear and love this product so much.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Iraheta

customer_reviews.title: Been using Simichrome for 50 years.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for ~50 years to polish brass buttons on black basket-weave leather around once a week. Works great &, even as much a I use it, each tube lasts several years. It does take a some elbow grease to get good results, so it might not be the right product for large, or numerous, brass items. I highly recommend it. * * * 6 stars * * *
customer_reviews.author: Bill Blackburn, Ukiah CA

customer_reviews.title: Some kind of magic for my pewter, awesome
customer_reviews.text: This stuff shined up my Goodwill pewter tray like you wouldn't believe. There were crazy streaks and stains all over this platter when I brought it home. It took a lot of product and a lot of elbow grease but the tray shines now! Only issue...It seems to take forever to completely wipe off the product. Like you think you are done, then you handle the piece a few hours later and black residue is getting on your hands. Yay it is more tarnish that can be wiped away. But eventually I want to put food on that serving dish...ew.
customer_reviews.author: Yup

customer_reviews.title: Top Product For Metal Polishing; Tested By Long Use
customer_reviews.text: I don't use that much metal polishing paste so the neat and sensible size package here works better for me than a tub with a pry-off lid. Just squeeze out what you need for the job at hand and screw the top back on. The familiar pink compound reacts to loosen tarnish and the fine grit in the mix aids in removing very light scratches. A polish type of protective coat is deposited once the residue has been buffed away. I LOVE how this works on a pewter wine coaster and it is just the thing for knife collectors or sportsmen to use in maintaining the polish on blade steels. I have used it for that purpose for many years.
customer_reviews.author: James EllsworthTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Polishes beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: This polish is superb. You need just a little dab, and it will pllish up that silver like no other polish can. It also leaves the darkened oxidation that makes old silver so beautiful, because the rubbing required to polish will not get into the crevices that need to remain darkened. (Unlike the dips which remove ALL oxidation, including the factory applied darkening. I've used this on brass, as well as copper, but it really does the best on silver. My old tube lasted 5 years, so this is why I have purchased a new tube - presumably it will last another 5 years!
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: It works but you have more of mess to clean. I prefer to save money and stick with vinegar. They both worked the same but the vinegar involved less effort
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Out of sight!
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? This paste cleans silver like it's going out of style. I saw it on the James Avery site w/ a polishing cloth for 20 bucks. Found it here for 7.49$. It also cleans copper and other metals. It only takes a dab. I'm completely impressed by its ability to shine my silver in no time. It takes very little elbow work. I highly recommend Simichrome paste.
customer_reviews.author: FiFi

customer_reviews.title: Great for watches!
customer_reviews.text: This polish is amazing. A couple dabs of this on some Q-tips and I've returned the shiny portions of my expensive Swiss watch to near-factory fresh levels of brilliance. Be aware that the smell of this polish is pretty strong. If you are a person that is sensitive to fumes you may want to wear a painter's mask while using this polish.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost - Mothers is as good and cheaper
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be no better than Mothers polish, but definitely much more expenaive. I cleaned/polished 3 separate drawer pulls with each having a similar result. The Simichrome and Mothers did about the same and Turtle Wax All Metal slightly worse. I've tried this product on different metals and compared them with Mothers being a little better in each. You get 10oz of Mothers for half of what you pay for 1.76oz of Simichrome. You don't need to be a math wiz to figure out which one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Greer

customer_reviews.title: A friend gave it rave reviews, and he was right
customer_reviews.text: A friend gave it rave reviews, and he was right. I used it to polish a badly tarnished piece of brass jewelry for my wife. I was afraid it was too shiny, but she loved it. That's all I've used it for so far, but my friend says it will polish almost anything (including some plastics), and my guess is that he's right. (But I'll test it first.)
customer_reviews.author: parallelidentity

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Reemoving Scratches
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product for removing small surface scratches. I bought this product to use in refinishing a guitar surface. There were lots of small scratches that really affected the appearance of the guitar. A very small drop of Simichrome was applied to the surface. Just a bit of elbow grease in rubbing out the scratches resulted in a much cleaner look. Small scratches disappeared. As with any finishing job be careful to not overuse the product or you may rub through the finish. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Linydreams

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Works well in a short time. Worth the money. Wouldn't use another cream on metal. Just follow the directions and you will have a beautiful brass pot. Interesting that I did the outside of "brass," and when I did the inside, (the pot came from China) the area which was corroded the pot was ONLY SPRAYED with brass, but was copper. No surprise from China.
customer_reviews.author: B J Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Great Polishing product
customer_reviews.text: This polishing paste came recommended to me for polishing 55 year old amplifier handle hardware. It is a very good polish I used it on wife’s silver rimmed serving dishes. It really works well, my friend that recommended it said it seemed to require fewer silver cleaning in comparison to other cleaners
customer_reviews.author: Edward Scott Allen

customer_reviews.title: It really works if you put in the time with patience
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this product worked on a chrome decoration I thought I would have to throw out due to pitting and corrosion. It's a lot of work, but shined my decor up to its original show piece glory! Tried silver polish that did nothing but this product actually works with a lot of patience and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very poor product. I have old brass door handles and locks that have tarnished. This product promises an awful lot that it doesn’t deliver. Lots of elbow grease, but you get a pink, not brass color. I replaced the hinges, but did not want to get new locks, levers other hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Gail D

customer_reviews.title: Best metal polish available period!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best metal polish in the world. I have used this product for years and will continue to do so. It is a great value because it works and works well and easily. You use SMALL amounts so it goes a long way. It is fast and effective and seems to leave a residue on the surface that prevents tarnish. I use this polish professionally and at home, I can not recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: NECC

customer_reviews.title: Simichrom 390050 All Metal Polish Tube - 1.76 oz.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to see if it would take some stains out of my stainless steel kitchen sink. I'm not sure how these stains originated, but they're more than just age or tarnish. It took a little bit of elbow grease but to my utter disbelief, the stains gradually worked their way out of the metal until they were completely gone. If you've spilled chemicals in the sink left stains, I highly recommend this product. I also used it on some tarnished brushed nickel faucets and they look like new. The polish was pretty well packaged and was delivered in a timely fashion.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: I never knew my brass table could look so good!
customer_reviews.text: This works so well on my very dirty but beautiful brass table. Since I have to also remove the layer of brass cleaner I couldn’t get off before, I’m taking a few days a little at a time. A normal person could knock it out in a couple of hours. The results are so impressive!
customer_reviews.author: P.M. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Miracle worker
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a product to remove silverware marks off my white dishes for a long time. My daughter-in-law recommended Simichrome, and it is amazing. No scrubbing...just apply and wipe; put it in dishwasher to remove residue. This is not the purpose of this product, but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stuff. When I was a kid in India we had something called "Brasso" that we used to polish all my mother's brass objects - it would make it all really shiny. This stuff smells just like "Brasso" and behaves in a similar fashion - removed grime and tarnish in an amazingly effective way. The tube is plastered with all sorts of health warnings, so I'm sure it's full of strong and nasty chemicals - but don't eat the dang thing and you should be fine. The amazing job it does on metals makes up for any brief exposure you have to it.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff. Kinda small tube - get 2.
customer_reviews.text: Wow this stuff is like magic. I have never polished anything before, and I was able to take a 3ft brass stanchion pole from a very dull copper color back to a mirror brass finish in about 30 minutes. Use lots of rags or those disposable shop rags. 1 tube did 1 pole and I have a little left over (not enough for the second pole).
customer_reviews.author: Coty C.

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well
customer_reviews.text: This is in a tube and can be applied directly to the item to be cleaned. Just be sure to wear gloves to protect your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It freaking works
customer_reviews.text: As the owner of a uncountable first-place trophies in custom antique Harley-Davidson shows there is no better clean or I've ever used in 35 years then semi Chrome yes you do have to put a coat of finish on it but that's the best cleaner is on the market I've ever used if it's not broke don't fix it
customer_reviews.author: Nicky De Risi

customer_reviews.title: excellent result
customer_reviews.text: I had very stubborn tarnish on my outdoor brass lamps that nothing was working to remove until I got this. It works beautifully and with little elbow grease.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Terrific metal polisher
customer_reviews.text: I bought this metal polisher after reading a review on Amazon, raving about how well it worked. I wanted something that was effective but not harsh. When I tried it on a delicate surface I held my breath. Whew! It did a great job without harming the finish in any way. The product arrived well-packed and was delivered promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G.

customer_reviews.title: Simichrome 390050 All Metal Polish Tube - 1.76 oz.
customer_reviews.text: Wow I used this polish to polish the ramp on a 1911 40 S&W gun barrel that I have some feed issues with . I put a radius around the entrance with a dermal tool then wet stoned it, then polished it with yellow Diamond compound . The finish was pretty good but not as good as I wanted . So I used a felt Bobbin with this polish and it did an even better polish than the yellow Diamond . good stuff
customer_reviews.author: M P H

customer_reviews.title: Not Just For Metal
customer_reviews.text: While Simichrome is a metal polish, it’s used on fine wood finishes to remove scratches with excellent results. Use just a bit with light pressure and quick removal - usually 2-4 applications to take fine scratches off of guitars and pianos (lacquer and poly finishes). This is an amazing product. Oh, and it work just as well on metal!
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought some very tarnished candle sticks cheap at a garage sale. When I found this product on amazon, I thought it might take away some of the tarnish but when I looked at the candle sticks closely, I really doubted it would do much. Lots of rubbing with very little product did an amazing job! One photo shows a completely tarnished candlestick beside the candle stick I cleaned but left the bottom tarnished so you could see the results. The other photo shows the completely tarnished candle stick with the completely cleaned candle stick. The cleaning cloth shows the tarnish removed. Pretty remarkable results! Definitely worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: Gardener 74

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: After almost 4 years, I still have the same tube. Definitely long lasting and gets my brass shiny everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M. Perea

customer_reviews.title: Cleans metal right up. Incl. carbon
customer_reviews.text: If you are cleaning any gold or silver colored metal, including precious metals this is what you want. Great for cleaning carbon residue from Stainless handguns, especially the cylinder. Hand polish the metal with a rag and remove with another clean rag, and buff using a Dremel buffing wheel. I wouldn’t suggest using on rings with any stones as it would get lodged into the mounts, but for any bands, gold, platinum or silver it will make it shine like new, possibly without a Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Polish I've Used
customer_reviews.text: I was a devoted user of Nevr-Dull until using this product. You have to wear gloves to use this but it works very fast and doesn't leave a greasy film like the other. I was shocked at how quick Simichrome works on silver. I used it on rusted vintage chrome as well and it was pretty miraculous.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Great and quick cleaner of all metals. Silver especially
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for over 15 years. I use it on silver, brass, copper, and gold. It was deskignes orinally for chrome. It is the best all metal cleaner I have ever found. I wi not be without it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing, usually these polishes do an ok job, but this stuff is just unreal. Brings chrome and polished nickel back to a brilliant shine without a lot of elbow grease or skill. Seems expensive for what you get, but it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great polishing compound.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Simichrome since the 70’s, primarily to polish brass. It is an effective polishing compound that leaves the surface very shiny. I recently needed to polish a silver knife that had been a gift from my daughter, but was completely out of polish. When I read that Simichrome could be used on silver I ordered a tube. I was quite happy with the results. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Works well and I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked really well on my copper and pretty well on my brass. The pieces I have, have been tarnished for a long time. This tube is pricey, but worth it to save on harder “elbow grease!” Also, there is no strong smell. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I use this to test vintage bakelite jewelry for authenticity and it works perfectly. A very small dab on a cotton swab rubbed on the jewelry in question and up pops a yellow tabacco colored stain and you known it's bakelite. This tube will last until the end of time.
customer_reviews.author: Tahirah R.

customer_reviews.title: this cleaned and shined the hardware on a very old bath tub
customer_reviews.text: paste is easy to work with. I used 0000 steel wool first, then polished with a cloth. After two applications the spout and drain cover look much better. Also used it to shine the chrome parts of my truck's exhaust system, nice!
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: It's good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my stained glass. It works better than anything else I've tried. Polishes the metal and the glass at the same time. Try it, you'll like it!
customer_reviews.author: esp...

customer_reviews.title: Wow. It really works!
customer_reviews.text: Used a Dremel and wool bits with this stuff on some dull alloy bicycle parts and wow what a difference. One pass and it's polished and looking great. Three passes and we're borderline mirror-like finish. Fantastic stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua H.

customer_reviews.title: Simichrome is the best metal polish period.
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Simichrome in 1963 when I bought my first motorcycle. That bike had polished aluminum engine cases and Simichrome allowed me to keep them looking beautiful. I have been using it ever since, and even though I have occasionally tried other products, I have never found any4hing that polishes aluminum and stainless like Simichrome.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for small blemishes and touch up.
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! I was skeptical that this would do what I needed done.....get fine scratches and small dings out of a sword blade. The product worked superbly on small cosmetic blemishes and leaves a uniform high polish luster. Excellent product!! Again, don’t expect miracles....if you have a significant scratch you will need to do some coarser sanding first and work up to this as the finishing abrasive but it really does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: JRM

customer_reviews.title: All you need
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several metal polishes and protectors.This is by far the best I have used. I wanted to clean and polish my golf clubs. It not only cleans and renew the appearance of my clubs but keeps them looking good for a long time. After playing a round, as always ,I just wipe them down with a damp cloth and they look great. Worth the price and a little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: geezer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! I've used other polish on my fish
customer_reviews.text: I have a large chrome fish that has been in my family since I was a kid, and it was from an antique store. Never in my whole life have I seen it so shiny. I originally bought this stuff to see if I had a set of Bakelite utensils (this polish is pink. if you rub it on bakelite, it will turn yellow, usually). After I tested the bakelite, I decided to polish my fish. AMAZING! I've used other polish on my fish, but it never turned out like this. Plus, it's stayed shiny for so long now. I highly recommend simichrome!!!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Have used for Years.
customer_reviews.text: Back in the show car days this was all we used. Still think its better than Mothers for ease of removal and the shine lasts longer. Nice to find it on Amazon as its getting harder to find in the stores now. Use it almost exclusively for final finish but works great to remove even tough oxidation on brass or Aluminum. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alchemy819

customer_reviews.title: Save on elbow grease!
customer_reviews.text: This produce was recommended by my clock and watchmaker. It works better than Brasso and other metal polishes. It did a superior job on my brass and sterling silver with much less rubbing and buffing than other products I have used. Don't be fooled by the small size of the tube....a little bit goes a very long way!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Richards

customer_reviews.title: This. Stuff. Is.  Incredible!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean polished nickel bathroom faucets and fixtures that tarnish very easily. This is by far the best product I have used! I have used Brass Protech and others and never would they fully get rid of water spots, etc. This stuff takes a little effort but even removed some sort of cleaning product that accidentally got sprayed on the faucets that nothing else removed - I truly thought the faucets were ruined. It’s amazing and will buy it from here on out!
customer_reviews.author: SAB

customer_reviews.title: Works well on tarnished nickel
customer_reviews.text: The only product I’ve tried that restores shine removes tarnish from oxidized and dull nickel. I’ve used this product to restore the bright and shine to vintage instrument nickel plated parts. Works wonders on nickel, chrome, and gold....
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus49

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for top-notch product
customer_reviews.text: Absolute best product to use for Chrome polishing. Delivered on time and as expected. Hard to find this item in local stores. Works better than any other brand advertised or available for purchase. I use on my Harley Davidson chrome and swear by it for all other chrome polishing needs.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Good for more than just polishing metal
customer_reviews.text: This product was as described. It was well-packaged and the tube is sturdy so no squishing out the crimped end. While I will use this to polish metal, the primary reason I bought it is because it can be used to identify different types of plastics and bakelite. Works well for that also.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Returned product
customer_reviews.text: Did not perform as stated. It turned my silver piece a dark gray that would not come off. Ruined the item. Brasso works better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Used for an old brass door knocker and handle but didn't work at all. Trying to clean to prepare house for sale. It took some of the dirt off that Brasso left but didn't make much of a difference at all. Very disappointed since the reviews were so great. Perhaps I am not using it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: CMRoss

customer_reviews.title: The Gold Standard of Metal Polishes
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of metal polishes out there and I've used quite a few, but I've not found one that works as well or holds a shine as long as this one. Tarnish comes off without a whole lot of effort, and the shine lasts quite a while. This polish has become my favorite. Reasonably priced and the tube lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jadie Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to clean my sterling silver ring, that had gotten spots on it. The ring was from James Avery, which is great quality and they recommended this product to clean their jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Voss

customer_reviews.title: My idea of a tried & true product
customer_reviews.text: This is a back up tube because I am rapidly using up another tube for several renovation projects. Over the years this has proved a reliable polish that achieves rapid results.
customer_reviews.author: Little Old Lady in Sac

customer_reviews.title: ♥️♥️♥️
customer_reviews.text: Omg!!! I tried your product for my GUCCI bag yesterday! I cleaned up an oxidized part of a zipper. It works! Thank you so much! I do not have to send my bag back to the store to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Great product for reviving dull metal finishes
customer_reviews.text: Great product for reviving dull metal finishes. Easy to apply. May take a lot of rubbing to get the finish back to original luster. It just depends on how badly tarnished the item is.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schuman

customer_reviews.title: The best stain remover ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review and it’s only because this stuff is AMAZING. We have Rohl polished nickel faucets in our bathroom that got very badly stained by a visitors toothpaste and face soap. I thought the stains would never come off and we’d have to replace the faucets. We tried vinegar, soap, a different polish someone at the hardware store recommended, etc and nothing worked. This stuff is great. It’s back to new!! So thankful for this polish. Don’t try anything else, just buy this!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle L Martin

customer_reviews.title: Took super thick old tarnish off
customer_reviews.text: Thick black tarnish had built up on my grandma’s serving dish that had probably not been used in at least sixty years. My usual supermarket silver polish couldn’t make a dent in it. This took it right off, with some elbow grease. Used up most of the tube but it’s a pretty big piece with a ton of tarnish. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mouser

customer_reviews.title: A little hard to find but a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Simichrone polish for the brass and nickel silver on my collectible knives, for years. This product is somewhat difficult to find in retail stores, and at times I have had to use other products. Seems Simichrome is the best. I even use this product to get rid of water and mineral stains on stainless steel coffee carafes, and kitchen knives. I highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Smoker man

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great for chrome exhaust tips and works well with power drill and polishing ball. Just spread a small amount on the exhaust tips and polish to very high shine. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Al Petro

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better polish
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. My license car plate holder is chrome and is only about a year old. It started corroding and looked like it had the measles for metal. I used this stuff one time and 95% of the corrosion was gone. The chrome is still shining and bright three months after applying it. Used several times a year, I am confident I can get rid of 100% of the corrosion. I highly recommend this product. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Allen E. Shinder

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic versitile product!
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing polish I've ever seen. I use it on pocket watch cases and it makes nickel look like a mirror. Great for silver nickel and brass, haven't tried it on anything else. Also works great to clear up foggy or hazed arcrylic watch crystals and headlight covers.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: So far, great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my mustang exhaust tips. I'd was very easy to use, and left a remarkable shine. So, yes, highly recommend. Just make sure you are using in a well ventilated area.
customer_reviews.author: rumblee1

product_meta.title: Simichrome 390050 All Metal Polish Tube - 1.76 oz.
product_meta.description: Used by professionals for years, Simichrome does a beautiful job of removing surface rust from chrome, polishing aluminum until it looks like new, even sprucing up delicate, heirloom family silver without leaving scratches or abrasive marks. Its unique, finely mixed formula produces a rich, brilliant shine on any uncoated, non-ferrous, metal surface including, brass, gold, silver, aluminum, magnesium, pewter, chrome, sterling, copper and stainless steel. In as little as 30 seconds, you can watch a small, faded item go from dull, oxidized metal to a having a perfect mirror finish. In addition to restoring the original luster, Simichrome also leaves an invisible, protective coating to prevent further tarnishing and help keep the shine much longer. A solid favorite for home, industry, auto, motorcycle and antique users, Simichrome is the fastest, most effective metal polishing and cleaning agent in the industry today.
feature_bullets: Used by professionals for years, Simichrome does a beautiful job of removing surface rust from chrome, polishing aluminum until it looks like new, even sprucing up delicate, heirloom family silver without leaving scratches or abrasive marks

Its unique, finely mixed formula produces a rich, brilliant shine on any uncoated, non-ferrous, metal surface including, brass, gold, silver, aluminum, magnesium, pewter, chrome, sterling, copper and stainless steel
In as little as 30 seconds, you can watch a small, faded item go from dull, oxidized metal to a having a perfect mirror finish
In addition to restoring the original luster, Simichrome also leaves an invisible, protective coating to prevent further tarnishing and help keep the shine much longer
A solid favorite for home, industry, auto, motorcycle and antique users, Simichrome is the fastest, most effective metal polishing and cleaning agent in the industry today
